Frame‐by‐Frame Analysis:

• Frame 1: The road curves to the right. Parked vehicles line the right‐hand side, and there are bicycle lane markings. No pedestrians or animals visible.  
• Frame 2: Same curved roadway layout; still no clear hazards in the travel lane.  
• Frame 3: A pedestrian crossing warning sign is visible ahead on the right, but no actual pedestrian appears to be in or near the lane.  
• Frame 4: Approaching the crosswalk area; headlights illuminate the road more, but no person is crossing.  
• Frame 5: An animal (likely a medium‐size four‐legged animal) is crossing from the driver’s left toward the center of the roadway, clearly in front of the ego vehicle’s path.

Contextual Reasoning:

Although a pedestrian crossing sign is present, actual footage shows no humans in the lane. Instead, Frame 5 reveals an animal in the immediate travel path, which would require slowing down to avoid hitting it. There is no red traffic light visible. Thus, the most relevant factor is the animal crossing.

Match to Answer Choices:

A. Pedestrian crossing ahead – No pedestrian is seen actually crossing.  
B. Animal on the road – Matches the clear sighting in Frame 5.  
C. Pedestrian crossing the road – Not observed in any frame.  
D. Red traffic light ahead – No traffic light in these frames shows red.

Provide the Best Answer:

<answer>B</answer>
